segment.source: You can create an ad campaign using the Dev Center dashboard to help promote your app and grow your app's user base.
segment.target: You can create an ad campaign using the Dev Center dashboard to help promote your app and grow your app's user base.

segment.source: Create an ad campaign for your app
segment.target: Create an ad campaign for your app

segment.source: Create an ad campaign for your app
segment.target: Create an ad campaign for your app

segment.source: You can create an ad campaign using the Dev Center dashboard to help promote your app and grow your app's user base.
segment.target: You can create an ad campaign using the Dev Center dashboard to help promote your app and grow your app's user base.

segment.source: When you create an ad campaign, other apps in the Windows Store will run ads for your app.
segment.target: When you create an ad campaign, other apps in the Windows Store will run ads for your app.

segment.source: By default, we will choose the target audience for your ads based on the settings for your app in the Dev Center dashboard, but you can optionally define your own audience.
segment.target: By default, we will choose the target audience for your ads based on the settings for your app in the Dev Center dashboard, but you can optionally define your own audience.

segment.source: You can also use a default set of ad templates or upload your own ad designs.
segment.target: You can also use a default set of ad templates or upload your own ad designs.

segment.source: For more details about ad campaigns, see Common questions about ad campaigns.
segment.target: For more details about ad campaigns, see Common questions about ad campaigns.

segment.source: Note You can create ad campaigns only for apps that have passed the final publishing phase of the app certification process.
segment.target: Note You can create ad campaigns only for apps that have passed the final publishing phase of the app certification process.

segment.source: Here's how to create an ad campaign to promote your app.
segment.target: Here's how to create an ad campaign to promote your app.

segment.source: From the left navigation menu on your app's page in the Dev Center dashboard, click Monetization Promote your app.
segment.target: From the left navigation menu on your app's page in the Dev Center dashboard, click Monetization Promote your app.

segment.source: Do one of the following:
segment.target: Do one of the following:

segment.source: If you have not yet created an ad campaign for this app, the Promote your app page displays information about the benefits of ad campaigns.
segment.target: If you have not yet created an ad campaign for this app, the Promote your app page displays information about the benefits of ad campaigns.

segment.source: Click Get started or Create an ad campaign.
segment.target: Click Get started or Create an ad campaign.

segment.source: If you have already created an ad campaign for this app, the Promote your app page lists your existing ad campaigns.
segment.target: If you have already created an ad campaign for this app, the Promote your app page lists your existing ad campaigns.

segment.source: Click New campaign.
segment.target: Click New campaign.

segment.source: On the New campaign page, define the overall settings for this campaign in the Campaign details section.
segment.target: On the New campaign page, define the overall settings for this campaign in the Campaign details section.

segment.source: Name your ad campaign in the Campaign name field.
segment.target: Name your ad campaign in the Campaign name field.

segment.source: Under Campaign type, choose one of these options:
segment.target: Under Campaign type, choose one of these options:

segment.source: Paid: These ads will run in any app that matches your app’s device and category.
segment.target: Paid: These ads will run in any app that matches your app’s device and category.

segment.source: House: These ads will only run in your apps (that match the advertised app’s device).
segment.target: House: These ads will only run in your apps (that match the advertised app’s device).

segment.source: House ads are free of charge.
segment.target: House ads are free of charge.

segment.source: For more information, see About house ads.
segment.target: For more information, see About house ads.

segment.source: Note If your app is not yet published, you will receive an error message on the New campaign page.
segment.target: Note If your app is not yet published, you will receive an error message on the New campaign page.

segment.source: You must wait for your app to be published before you can create an ad campaign for it.
segment.target: You must wait for your app to be published before you can create an ad campaign for it.

segment.source: By default, we will choose the audience for your ads, based on the settings you selected when creating the app in the Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: By default, we will choose the audience for your ads, based on the settings you selected when creating the app in the Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: If you would rather choose the audience for your ads yourself, select Switch to manual targeting to expand the Audience section.
segment.target: If you would rather choose the audience for your ads yourself, select Switch to manual targeting to expand the Audience section.

segment.source: If you want to go back to default targeting, select Switch to auto targeting.
segment.target: If you want to go back to default targeting, select Switch to auto targeting.

segment.source: If you select Switch to manual targeting, you can edit the following targeting information:
segment.target: If you select Switch to manual targeting, you can edit the following targeting information:

segment.source: Choose the countries or regions in which you want these ads to appear.
segment.target: Choose the countries or regions in which you want these ads to appear.

segment.source: You can choose up to 5.
segment.target: You can choose up to 5.

segment.source: For a list of the supported countries or regions, see Common questions.
segment.target: For a list of the supported countries or regions, see Common questions.

segment.source: Choose the device types on which you want these ads to appear.
segment.target: Choose the device types on which you want these ads to appear.

segment.source: Only the device types supported by your app are shown.
segment.target: Only the device types supported by your app are shown.

segment.source: Choose the operating system.
segment.target: Choose the operating system.

segment.source: Only the operating systems supported by your app are shown.
segment.target: Only the operating systems supported by your app are shown.

segment.source: Select the gender and age range of your desired audience.
segment.target: Select the gender and age range of your desired audience.

segment.source: This section also displays an Estimated Reach graph.
segment.target: This section also displays an Estimated Reach graph.

segment.source: This graph shows the audience you can reach with your current targeting selections as a percentage of all Windows ad-enabled app users in the selected markets.
segment.target: This graph shows the audience you can reach with your current targeting selections as a percentage of all Windows ad-enabled app users in the selected markets.

segment.source: In the Ad design section, choose one of these options:
segment.target: In the Ad design section, choose one of these options:

segment.source: Upload my ad.
segment.target: Upload my ad.

segment.source: Choose this option to use your own ad designs.
segment.target: Choose this option to use your own ad designs.

segment.source: You can upload different files for each of the available ad sizes.
segment.target: You can upload different files for each of the available ad sizes.

segment.source: The files must meet the following requirements and guidelines:
segment.target: The files must meet the following requirements and guidelines:

segment.source: Each file must be a .png or .jpg that is less than 2 MB.
segment.target: Each file must be a .png or .jpg that is less than 2 MB.

segment.source: Your ad designs must meet the requirements specified in the Microsoft Creative Acceptance Policy.
segment.target: Your ad designs must meet the requirements specified in the Microsoft Creative Acceptance Policy.

segment.source: The content in your ad designs must be relevant to the app you are promoting.
segment.target: The content in your ad designs must be relevant to the app you are promoting.

segment.source: Ad designs that are not related to the app will not be distributed to ads in other apps.
segment.target: Ad designs that are not related to the app will not be distributed to ads in other apps.

segment.source: All content in your ad designs should be clearly legible.
segment.target: All content in your ad designs should be clearly legible.

segment.source: For example, content should not be blurred, pixelated or stretched.
segment.target: For example, content should not be blurred, pixelated or stretched.

segment.source: Auto generated ad.
segment.target: Auto generated ad.

segment.source: Choose this option to use ads from a list of default templates.
segment.target: Choose this option to use ads from a list of default templates.

segment.source: You have the following options to customize the content in the ads.
segment.target: You have the following options to customize the content in the ads.

segment.source: As you make selections, the previews of your ads will update automatically.
segment.target: As you make selections, the previews of your ads will update automatically.

segment.source: Select the Show my app rating checkbox if you want to show the app's rating.
segment.target: Select the Show my app rating checkbox if you want to show the app's rating.

segment.source: If your app is free in all the selected markets, you will also have the option to Show that my app is free.
segment.target: If your app is free in all the selected markets, you will also have the option to Show that my app is free.

segment.source: In the Language drop-down, select the language of the ads.
segment.target: In the Language drop-down, select the language of the ads.

segment.source: The text for the Windows Store badge and your custom tag line text (if specified) will show in the language you select.
segment.target: The text for the Windows Store badge and your custom tag line text (if specified) will show in the language you select.

segment.source: To add an extra line of text to your ad, enter the text in the Custom tag line field.
segment.target: To add an extra line of text to your ad, enter the text in the Custom tag line field.

segment.source: Note The text you enter must be localized into the selected language.
segment.target: Note The text you enter must be localized into the selected language.

segment.source: The custom tag line will be rejected if the text does not align with Bing Ads policies.
segment.target: The custom tag line will be rejected if the text does not align with Bing Ads policies.

segment.source: Consult this page for guidance on style and disallowed content.
segment.target: Consult this page for guidance on style and disallowed content.

segment.source: To choose a background color and an image for your ads, expand Customize ad design / See all ad sizes.
segment.target: To choose a background color and an image for your ads, expand Customize ad design / See all ad sizes.

segment.source: The available images are the images you have associated with your app in the Store.
segment.target: The available images are the images you have associated with your app in the Store.

segment.source: Now choose your ad campaign's financial settings in the Budget and payment section.
segment.target: Now choose your ad campaign's financial settings in the Budget and payment section.

segment.source: Note If you are creating a house ad campaign, the Budget and payment section will not appear, since house ads are free of charge.
segment.target: Note If you are creating a house ad campaign, the Budget and payment section will not appear, since house ads are free of charge.

segment.source: Under Budget, use the slider to set the amount of money you want to spend each month to run this ad.
segment.target: Under Budget, use the slider to set the amount of money you want to spend each month to run this ad.

segment.source: The monthly budget is prorated for the month in which the ad campaign is created.
segment.target: The monthly budget is prorated for the month in which the ad campaign is created.

segment.source: In other words, if you create an ad campaign halfway through a calendar month, you will be charged for half of your monthly budget for that month.
segment.target: In other words, if you create an ad campaign halfway through a calendar month, you will be charged for half of your monthly budget for that month.

segment.source: Set a payment instrument for your ad campaign by clicking Add new payment instrument and fill in your account details.
segment.target: Set a payment instrument for your ad campaign by clicking Add new payment instrument and fill in your account details.

segment.source: Important The country/region of your payment instrument's billing address must match the country/region associated with your Dev Center account.
segment.target: Important The country/region of your payment instrument's billing address must match the country/region associated with your Dev Center account.

segment.source: Finally, click Review to confirm your ad campaign's settings and, if it's a Paid ad campaign, its budget and payment information.
segment.target: Finally, click Review to confirm your ad campaign's settings and, if it's a Paid ad campaign, its budget and payment information.

segment.source: Click Confirm and your ads will typically start appearing on Windows or Windows Phone devices within a few hours!
segment.target: Click Confirm and your ads will typically start appearing on Windows or Windows Phone devices within a few hours!

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics
